name: Caitlynn Collier
text: Great fields, but when it comes to intramural sports the faculty (referees) are just plain awful. You shouldn't host a sport when you have people working out there that have no idea what they're doing. Especially when the refs are students that ref for a team just because they have friends on it. Great fields but I wouldn't play intramural sports through Auburn University.

name: Cassidy Roby
text: Love it just wish It never got locked up

name: Ann Martin
text: Was cold ,cloudy, windy day! Nearly froze!

name: Daniel Layne
text: Great fields for soccer, football, ultimate Frisbee, etc. Plenty of space.

name: Nathan Anderson
text: Nice field, acceptable playing surface

name: Margo Langley
text: Great!

text: Great!

name: Art Of Valor
text: Very nice and well maintained facility!

name: John Brown
text: very nice complex. kid friendly!

name: A McCarley
text: The facilities are great!

name: Nick Bailey
text: Clean and fun!

name: Michael LeRoy (strat57)
text: Go Hawks!

name: Mike Lane
text: Great but they need to fix the sign. It's dark out there hard to see drive

name: Amy B
text: Evangel is the best cover school around. It's sports program is top notch!

name: Walter Brush
text: Not nearly enough seats! OR parking spaces! Plus, because it had rained, it was pretty much a MUD hole.  Also couldn't see most of the game cause was low on the sideline and the team moved up and down the field always at the line of scrimmage - so never was able to see much of anything!  - from a frustrated grandparent.

name: Corla Whitfield
text: Great place, friendly, needs more restrooms.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are happy to say that we have been blessed with the addition of additional women's restrooms thanks to the generosity and hard work of a number of our families. Praise the Lord!

name: Chibuike Ulasi
text: Beautiful soccer field. The kids had a great time playing soccer today and the weather was nice.

name: Natasha Battle
text: Plenty of room

name: Bobby Bowen
text: My son plays soccer here. The soccer environment is good and the fields are taken care of, but some of the fields are not level and that's a pretty important thing in soccer. I wish Hoover would build a real complex since soccer is fairly popular here.

name: Robby
text: Nice fields

name: Matthew harkins
text: We lost our game

name: Marouf Safia
text: Great

name: Robert Hayes
text: Nice complex

name: Jan Wagner
text: Great facility for Senior Olympics.

name: Joshua Rollins
text: Better of the two fields in my opinion. This field is newer and the drainage is a little better. When weather rolls in, Field #1 is prone to holding water from second base out to the grass.

name: Brian Moore (Armyballer)
text: Great fields NASA, never thought I'd see the day when the Army Fields on an Army base are unplayable...props to NASA for letting us poor Army folk use them.

name: Nikki Buxman
text: Softball. Controls for score board too difficult to use

name: Teresa Austin
text: Great place for the kids to play ball.

name: Douglas Keck
text: Great atmosphere and games

name: Kitty Carson
text: Absolutely beautiful! Amazing array of parks and the amphitheater was the crown jewel for watching a concert. The gentle downward glide of the grassy seating made it so easy to see and hear everything!

name: Speakman28
text: It is very nice and well designed. You don't feel crowded or cramped. There is plenty of space for seating or for groups to sit together. It could use a few signs with arrows and names of locations to let you know what direction you are headed.

name: Jana Cox
text: Music Lovers Beware!  Once you attend a concert at Sand Mountain Amphitheater, you will not want to visit anywhere else.  The sound is amazing, views are awesome and the two video boards are first class! This is a great facility for any size city.  Way to go, Albertville!

name: Debbie Culpepper
text: What a great new complex!! My only complaint would be a need for more parking near the ball fields.

name: Patrick Nein
text: The new amphitheater is awesome. The whole complex is huge and a great addition to Albertville.

name: Anne Duckett
text: The sound was awesome and the atmosphere was great!

name: Mara “Pitufa” Feliciano
text: Amazing

name: Tami Hagan
text: Loved it

name: Antoine Bell
text: This state of the art facility is one of best adapted athletics venues in the country.

name: Lara Polk
text: I took my son here to see an Alabama wheelchair basketball game and we had the best time of our lives. We are treated like we were just part of the family. my son plays wheelchair basketball for Lakeshore and it was a dream come true for him to come see Alabama play. I can say one thing they made my son feel very special and it was a great time for us to make tons of memories.

name: Christa Jones
text: The MOST amazing facility for adapted athletics in the US! Perfect place to watch and learn about adapted sports!! MUST SEE when you visit BAMA!! Roll Tide!

name: Larry Canada
text: Beautiful and modern, and a great facility to watch National Championship Basketball.

name: Princess
text: This location hosts UA wheelchair basketball, such great games!

name: Sonja Williams
text: Nice Place, I'd recommend the benches be bolted to the ground for wheelchair users. I had a hard time getting off the ground cause the bench was Lifting Up when I push on it to in My Wheelchair!

name: thatdisabledude33
text: It was great except we lost there

name: Kelvin Fields
text: An excellent place from wheelchair basketball!
